sentences.sContent: Some of the most efficient refrigerators consume 70 percent less electricity than traditional models.
sentences.sCn: 一些能效最高的冰箱比传统型号少消耗70%的电。

sentences.sContent: ...Indians likewise had their traditional life taken from them by white settlers who often encourage them to consume alcohol to prevent them from fighting back...
...who produce and consume their own energy onsite...
...Nearly all the cultural objects we consume arrive wrapped in inherited opinion; our preferences are always...
...President Obama will no doubt make the point publicly when he gets to Beijing: the Chinese need to consume more; they need—believe it or not—to become more like Americans...

remMethod.val: con(全部) ＋ sum(取) ＋ e → 把钱全部取出消费， 吃喝 → 消费

words.tran: 消耗性的；浪费的；肺病的
保护消费者利益运动；用户至上主义
消耗（consume的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranOther: To consume an amount of fuel, energy, or time means to use it up
to use time, energy, goods etc
